data.fullContent: Emergency medical technicians (EMTs), also known as first responders, are an emergency service that offers assistance to victims of medical emergencies. They provide emergency care at the site of the emergency in order to stabilize a patient so that they can be taken to the emergency department of a local hospital, or in some cases, treated in the field. EMTs may work for a medical service provider such as a hospital, a physician's office, or the local fire department. EMTs may also work as independent contractors. In developing countries, many EMT positions are filled by laypeople with no formal EMT training, although these practitioners may be highly skilled and competent.

q1.translation: 紧急医疗技术人员(EMTs)，也被称为第一反应人员，是一种为医疗紧急情况的受害者提供援助的紧急服务。他们在紧急情况现场提供紧急护理，以稳定患者的病情，以便将患者送往当地医院的急诊科，或在某些情况下在现场治疗。

They provide emergency care at the site of the emergency in ____ to stabilize a patient so ____ they can be taken to the emergency ____ of a local hospital, or in some cases, treated in the field.

q2.translation: 紧急医疗技术人员(EMTs)，也被称为第一反应人员，是一种为医疗紧急情况的受害者提供援助的紧急服务。他们在紧急情况现场提供紧急护理，以稳定患者的病情，以便将患者送往当地医院的急诊科，或在某些情况下在现场治疗。EMTs可能为医疗服务提供者工作，如医院、医生办公室或当地消防部门。急救人员也可以作为独立承包商工作。在发展中国家，许多EMT职位由没有接受过正规培训的外行人担任，尽管这些从业人员可能具有很高的技能和能力。
q2.front: Emergency medical technicians (EMTs), also known as first responders, are an emergency service that offers assistance to victims of medical emergencies. They provide emergency care at the site of the emergency in order to stabilize a patient so that they can be taken to the emergency department of a local hospital, or in some cases, treated in the field.
q2.middle: EMTs may work for a medical service provider such as a hospital, a physician's office, or the local fire department.
q2.ending: EMTs may also work as independent contractors. In developing countries, many EMT positions are filled by laypeople with no formal EMT training, although these practitioners may be highly skilled and competent.

options.sentence: These ambulances were often staffed by regular city police officers who used their equipment to transport the patients.
EMTs may work for a medical service provider such as a hospital, a physician's office, or the local fire department.
For example, emergency responders might need to evacuate people or stabilize situations before an ambulance can arrive on the scene.
When the automobile became the predominant means of transportation during the 1900s, EMTs became more commonly known as medics.

options.sentence: EMTs provide on-site medical care to patients having medical emergencies so that they can be taken to a hospital.
In the mid-1800s, the first ambulances were developed to transport the sick and injured across long distances.
By 1910, 12 U.S. cities had established ambulance services, including Boston, Philadelphia, New Orleans, and New York City.
The history of emergency medical services is as dynamic as the changing landscape of society.
